usabhavatī： usabhavatī（ti）
ဥသဘဝတီ（တိ）
«usabhavantu+ī»
[ဥသဘဝန္တု+ဤ]

Usabhavatī：1．Usabhavatī．-A city where，in the pleasaunce near by，Paduma Buddha spent a rainy season．The citizens gave a special kathina-robe to his chief disciple，Sāla （BuA．148）．According to the Buddhavamsa Commentary （p．173），Piyadassī Buddha preached his first sermon in the same pleasaunce，but the Buddhavamsa （xiv．119） gives its name as Ussāvana．



2．Usabhavatī．-The city in which the Buddha Vessabhū died，at the Khemārāma．BuA．209．

usabhavatī：ဥသဘဝတီ（တိ）
[ဥသဘဝန္တု+ဤ]
နွားလားဥသဘ-ရှိ-ပေါများ-သော၊ ဥသဘဝတီမည်သော၊ （မြို့）။ ဥသဘဝတီနဂရ-ကြည့်။
